articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Sinuiju Measuring Instrument Factory
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Sinuiju Measuring Instrument Factory
						
 Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, inspected the Sinuiju Measuring Instrument Factory.
					 Saying that he was so pleased to receive a report about world-class ultra-modern measuring instruments developed by the factory and came to meet the developers, the supreme leader highly appreciated their feats.
					
					 He looked round a monument to revolutionary activities of the great leaders and a room for education in their revolutionary history.
					
					 He expressed great satisfaction over the fact that the factory, to which President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il had always paid deep attention and he, too, attaches very great importance, manufactured new modern measuring instruments to be used in various fields of the national economy and defense industry and thus carried out another behest of the great leaders.
					
					 After touring processing and assembling shops, sci-tech room and other parts of the factory, he learned in detail about the technical specifications and performance of the newly-developed measuring instruments.
					
					 The instruments are of the world level, he said, adding it is a remarkable success that such ultra-modern instruments were manufactured with indigenous efforts and technology.
					
					 The factory provided a big stepping-stone for developing the nation's field of measuring instrument production at a leaping pace and speeding up the building of a prosperous country, he said.
					
					 Noting the factory has a very important role to play, he indicated the tasks facing it.
					
					 He set the goals to be attained by the factory in production, urging it to increase the output of measuring instruments developed on a higher level of Juche-orientation, modernization and localization.
					
					 Stressing the need to modernize the factory as required by the age of knowledge-based economy in order to drastically raise the output of ultra-modern measuring instruments of Korean style and ensure their quality, he called for turning it into a manpower-saving factory and an icon factory in the field of measuring instrument production by putting all its production processes on an automated and CNC basis.
					
					 Going round a canteen and supply service facilities of the factory, he said that, as always mentioned, bigger success can be made in production only when better living conditions are provided for the workers. And he indicated the ways for further improving its supply service.
					
					 The workers at the factory are strong in revolutionary spirit and there will be nothing impossible to do when going together with such workers, he said, adding he would become an honorary manager of the factory, an expression of his deepest trust.
					
					 There is no fortress unconquerable when our workers live and struggle like those of Kunja-ri in the 1950s, he said, stressing that it is advisable to conduct a higher level of mass movement for learning from the working spirit and traits of the Kunja-ri workers as well as the Three-Revolution Red Flag Movement.
					
					 He had a photo session with the officials and employees of the factory, expressing belief that they would make positive contribution to the building of a thriving country by developing and producing more measuring instruments, true to the Workers' Party of Korea's line of building an economic power and its strategic plan.
					
					 Accompanying him were Kim Chun Sop, Jo Chun Ryong, Jo Yong Won, Hong Yong Chil and Yun Tong Hyon.

articles.title: Greetings to Cuban FM
articles.content:
Greetings to Cuban FM
						
 Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong sent a message of greeting to his Cuban counterpart Bruno Rodriguez Parrilla on Aug. 22 on the occasion of the 55th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and the Republic of Cuba.
					 The traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries are growing strong amid a joint struggle for socialism against imperialism, the message said, expressing full support and firm solidarity with the government and people of Cuba in their struggle for successfully building socialism.

articles.title: Talks between Yang Hyong Sop and First Vice-President of Council of State of Cuba Held
articles.content:
Talks between Yang Hyong Sop and First Vice-President of Council of State of Cuba Held
						
 Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- There took place talks between Yang Hyong Sop, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, and Miguel Diaz－Canel Bermudez, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba, first vice-president of the Council of State and first vice-president of the Council of Ministers of Cuba, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Friday.
					 Present there from the DPRK side were Kim Sung Du, chairman of the Education Commission who doubles as chairman of the Korean Committee for Solidarity with Cuba, Pak Kun Gwang, vice-department director of the C.C., WPK, Sin Hong Chol, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ri Kwang Gun, vice-minister of External Economic Relations, So Ho Won, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and from the Cuban side members of the Cuban delegation.
					
					 At the talks both sides exchanged their views on the issue of developing the friendly relations between the two countries and matters of mutual concern.
					
					 Before the talks a ceremony of welcoming the delegation took place.

articles.title: Cuban State Delegation Arrives Here
articles.content:
Cuban State Delegation Arrives Here
 Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- A Cuban state delegation headed by Miguel Diaz-Canel Bermudez, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba, first vice-president of the Council of State and first vice-president of the Council of Ministers of Cuba, arrived here on Friday.
					 It was greeted at Pyongyang International Airport by DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong, Ri Kwang Gun, vice-minister of External Economic Relations, So Ho Won, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, officials concerned and staff members of the Cuban embassy here.

articles.title: Cuban State Delegation Pays Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Cuban State Delegation Pays Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il 
						
 Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- A Cuban state delegation headed by Miguel Diaz-Canel Bermudez, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba, first vice-president of the Council of State and first vice-president of the Council of Ministers of Cuba, visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Friday.
					 Present there were Ri Su Yong, foreign minister, and Ri Kwang Gun, vice-minister of External Economic Relations, officials concerned and staff members of the Cuban embassy here.
					
					 They laid a floral basket before the statues and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Cuban State Delegation Feted
articles.content:
Cuban State Delegation Feted
						
 Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- The Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly hosted a banquet in honor of the visiting state delegation of the Republic of Cuba at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Friday.
					 Present at the banquet on invitation were the delegation headed by Miguel Diaz－Canel Bermudez, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba, first vice-president of the Council of State and first vice-president of the Council of Ministers of Cuba, and staff members of the Cuban embassy here.
					
					 Present there were Yang Hyong Sop, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK SPA, Kim Sung Du, chairman of the Education Commission who doubles as chairman of the Korean Committee for Solidarity with Cuba, and officials concerned.
					
					 Yang Hyong Sop said in his speech at the banquet that the delegation's visit to the DPRK marked an important occasion in boosting the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Cuba and powerfully demonstrating the militant might of the two peoples advancing shoulder to shoulder along the road of independence and socialism against imperialism. 
					
					 Highly praising the government and people of Cuba for extending unequivocal support and solidarity to the Korean people in their just cause true to the revolutionary principle and the sense of comradely obligation, he clarified the firm stand of the government of the DPRK to boost the friendly and cooperative relations with the fraternal Cuban people generation after generation.
					
					 Miguel Diaz－Canel Bermudez noted in his speech that the invincible relations of friendship between Cuba and the DPRK provided by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il with Comrades Fidel Castro Ruz and Raul Castro Ruz have grown stronger under the special care of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Expressing deep thanks to Korean comrades for cordial reception and kindness, he stressed that the friendly relations between the two countries would be eternal and the Cuban people would always stand by the Korean people.

articles.title: Delegation of Union of Korean Students in Japan Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Delegation of Union of Korean Students in Japan Visits Mangyongdae
						
 Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- A delegation for marking the 70th anniversary of the formation of the Union of Korean Students in Japan led by Kim Hyon Il, chairman of its Central Standing Committee, visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 They laid bouquets before the graves of Kim Po Hyon and Ri Po Ik, grandparents of the President, and Kim Hyong Jik and Kang Pan Sok, his parents, and paid silent tribute to them.
					
					 They looked round historic relics preserved with much care at his old home in Mangyongdae, being briefed on his revolutionary history and the patriotic life of his family members.
					
					 They went round revolutionary sites on Mangyong Hill.
					
					 At the end of the visit the head of the delegation said that the visit to the old home of the President helped him renew the determination to successfully bring up the younger generation of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan as desired by the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu.
					
					 The delegation also toured the Arch of Triumph, the Tower of the Juche Idea, the Fatherland Liberation War Martyrs Cemetery, etc.

articles.title: DPRK State Merited Chorus Gives Performance for Guests of Honor in Khabarovsk
articles.content:
DPRK State Merited Chorus Gives Performance for Guests of Honor in Khabarovsk
						
 Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- The members of the State Merited Chorus of the DPRK on a visit to Russia gave a performance for guests of honor in Khabarovsk City of Russia on Thursday. 
					 The Khabarovsk Territory Music Theatre was crowded with people to enjoy the performance. 
					
					 Invited to watch the performance were Deputy Prime Minister Victor Martsenko, Minister of Culture Nataliya Yakutsina and Minister of Education Ala Kuznetsova of the Khabarovsk Territory Administration. 
					
					 Among the audience were personages of the Khabarovsk Territory Administration and Assembly, Khabarovsk City Administration and education, literature and arts, media and other circles, service personnel of the Eastern Military District of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation, citizens and Koreans in Russia, Consul General Im Chon Il and staff members of the DPRK Consulate General in Nakhodka. 
					
					 Put on the stage first was orchestral music "Pyongyang Is Best" which deeply impressed the audience as it reflects the warm love of the Korean people for the homeland of Juche daily developing into a highly civilized socialist nation thanks to the great intention of Marshal Kim Jong Un to build a thriving nation and his wise guidance. 
					
					 Also put on the stage were orchestra and male chorus "Song of the Korean People's Army", female solos and male choruses "Sea of Apples at Foot of Chol Pass" and "Peace Is Guaranteed by Our Arms", male chorus of Russian song "Forward", male chorus and light music "Song of Proud Guards Units", Russian song "Soldiers, Brave Men". They represented the revolutionary spirit and militant optimism of Songun Korea and national flavor of the Russian people. 
					
					 The performers made a truthful artistic representation of the faith and will of the DPRK and the desire of the two peoples to boost the DPRK-Russia friendly ties. 
					
					 Artistes of the song and dance ensemble of the Eastern Military District of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation sang male duet of the Russian song "The Naval Port at Night" to the accompaniment of recital of the State Merited Chorus, peculiarly decorating the stage. 
					
					 When the image of Kim Jong Un standing atop Mt. Paektu, sacred mountain of the revolution, despite its blizzards was projected on the background of the stage and male quintet "Let Us Not Abandon Revolutionary Faith Though One May Die" and male chorus "We Will Go to Mt. Paektu" resounded forth, the whole audience broke into enthusiastic applause. 
					
					 At the end of the performance audience presented floral baskets and bouquets to the performers, congratulating them on their successful performance.
					
					 The performance given by the State Merited Chorus evoked a lively response among Russians in the city.

articles.title: Members of State Merited Chorus of DPRK Visit Various Places of Moscow
articles.content:
Members of State Merited Chorus of DPRK Visit Various Places of Moscow
						
 Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- The members of the State Merited Chorus of the DPRK toured various places of Moscow. It visited Russia this year, the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation and the 70th anniversary of the victory of the great Patriotic War in Russia, a significant year of the DPRK-Russia friendship.
					 They visited the Central Museum of the Great Patriotic War.
					
					 Being briefed on the feats the soldiers of the red army and people performed by fighting and annihilating the fascist aggressors to achieve the victory of war while bearing the brunt of the Second World War in the period of the Soviet Union-Germany war, they looked round various places of the museum including rooms showing battles in Moscow and Kursk and a room showing the capturing of Berlin.
					
					 They also toured the Lenin Mausoleum at the Red Square and the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier by the wall of the Kremlin.

articles.title: Kim Hyong Jik University of Education
articles.content:
Kim Hyong Jik University of Education
 Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- Kim Hyong Jik University of Education is one of those taking the lead in the development of educational science in the DPRK.
					 It serves as a center of scientific studies, information, database and tele-education for other universities of education.
					
					 It is paying primary efforts to training students to be competent practitioners, while giving much weight to subjects dealing with practical issues.
					
					 Psychological diagnostics, psychological sanitary science and other educational fields have been newly developed.
					
					 Such achievements are of weighty significance in improving the qualification of officials and teachers in the field of education.

articles.title: DPRK Beats Bahrain at Away Match in Second-Round Asian Qualifier
articles.content:
DPRK Beats Bahrain at Away Match in Second-Round Asian Qualifier
						
 Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- The DPRK football team beat its Bahraini rival 1:0 at its away match in a second-round Asian qualifier for the 2018 FIFA World Cup on Thursday.

articles.title: Japan's Reinvasion Will Bring Self-Destruction: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Japan's Reinvasion Will Bring Self-Destruction: Rodong Sinmun
						
 Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- The "statement on 70 years after defeat in Pacific War" made public by Japan is its undisguised declaration of its intention to rush headlong into reinvasion, never admitting its past crimes.
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun Friday says that state-sponsored frantic militaristic moves stepped up by Japan in these days are reminiscent of the days when the Japanese imperialists whetted their swords for aggression to become "leader of the East."
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 Hysteria of Japan, a copy of the past fascist empire in terms of its width, depth and fever, is not just a product of ultra-right movement of the present ruling quarters but an outcome of the march they have made for the past seven decades for militarization while crying out for reinvasion.
					
					 Japan is no longer a "pacifist state" repeatedly touted by rulers.
					
					 It is getting frantic with moves for militarization with political camp, military and munitions complex knitted together. It is a war state keen on overseas aggression and an unstable factor of threatening regional peace and security.
					
					 However, militarist Japan which was revived to seek revenge for its defeat is sadly mistaken. Reinvasion would bring it another defeat and self-destruction. As the Japanese imperialist history of aggression ended in its defeat, the future of revived militarist Japan cannot be otherwise.
					
					 Japan should bear in mind that the way for guaranteeing its survival is to liquidate its crime-woven past as early as possible with its proper outlook on history and morality.
					
					 This is a serious warning to Japan which chose reinvasion as its state policy.

articles.title: North and South Can Make New History of Inter-Korean Ties If They Have Will: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
North and South Can Make New History of Inter-Korean Ties If They Have Will: Rodong Sinmun 
						
 Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- The intrinsic requirement for the successful implementation of the recent north-south agreement is to advance, looking far into the future, not maintaining the concept of confrontation being stuck to the past, says Rodong Sinmun Friday in an article.
					 The implementation of the agreement is by no means a smooth sailing. The birth of things new is bound to be accompanied with difficulties. If the north and the south remain true to the spirit of the agreement reached between them and have will to part with the inglorious past, they can surely write a new history of bilateral relations, meeting all challenges.
					
					 It is necessary to advance in the constructive direction of defusing mistrust and confrontation between compatriots and developing the inter-Korean relations for reunification. This is the patriotic way the north and the south should choose for the destiny of the nation and the bright future of a reunified country. 
					
					 It is the unanimous desire of the Korean nation for both sides to refrain from standing in confrontation but pool efforts to open up a new avenue for reunification. The nation has ability to do so.
					
					 The world is steadily advancing. The north and the south should no longer waste time and energy because of meaningless disputes and unimportant matters. The hearts of the Koreans bruised due to the division of the nation after the country's liberation do not allow such practice.
					
					 The north and the south have good experience in which they opened up an epochal phase of national unity and the improvement of the north-south relations, away from mistrust and confrontation for reunification.
					
					 All the Koreans require the north and the south to positively create a constructive atmosphere of improving the inter-Korean relations on the basis of the precious experience of history and a bitter lesson drawn from the situation.
					
					 If they actively respond to the nation's expectation and trust with a patriotic decision, the recent agreement is sure to bear good fruits.

articles.title: Japanese Government's Apology and Reparation for Massacre of Koreans Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Japanese Government's Apology and Reparation for Massacre of Koreans Demanded in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- More than 120 national organizations of south Korea including the "Federation of Homogeneous Nation Movement Organizations" made public a joint statement on Sept. 1 in demand of an apology and reparation of the Japanese government 92 years since the Japanese imperialists ruthlessly killed Koreans during the great Kanto earthquake, according to the south Korean internet newspaper Thongil News.
					 The statement disclosed that the Japanese government not only took part in killing Koreans but also encouraged and connived at the massacre.
					
					 It urged the Japanese government to make a sincere apology and reparation for the massacre of the Koreans during the great Kanto earthquake.

articles.title: Illegal Surveillance in S. Korea Disclosed
articles.content:
Illegal Surveillance in S. Korea Disclosed 
 Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- South Korean investigation institutions were recently disclosed to have illegally monitored communications among people, sparking off a furor.
					 According to the south Korean website News 1 on August 26, the Intelligence Service, the prosecution, police and military investigation institutions forced communications enterprises to hand over communications to them and investigated at least 82 245 445 data in three years since 2012.
					
					 These data reportedly included time of phone messages, e-mail, etc. phone numbers, internet records and IP addresses.
					
					 The present ruling forces have intensified the monitoring system after planting agents of the Intelligence Service involved in the suppression of opposition forces and youth and students during the Lee Myung Bak regime in the office of the chief secretary for civilian administration of Chongwadae.

articles.title: S. Korea Not Allowed to Punish GI Criminals
articles.content:
S. Korea Not Allowed to Punish GI Criminals
						
 Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- 1 766 U.S. imperialist aggression troops in south Korea had committed crimes from 2010 to June, this year, counting only those disclosed, south Korean Yonhap News said.
					 But south Korea has failed to exercise jurisdiction as the criminals were handed to the U.S. forces side under the SOFA.
					
					 South Korean lawyers, therefore, filed a suit with the Ministry of Justice against its unofficial disposal of information related to GI crimes.
					
					 But the Seoul High Court made such humiliating decision that there is no need to open to public all information.

articles.title: DPRK Praised by Guinean and Nigerian Personages
articles.content:
DPRK Praised by Guinean and Nigerian Personages 
						
 Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- Lectures, a photo exhibition and film shows took place in Guinea and Nigeria on August 27 and 28 with the approach of the 67th anniversary of the founding of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea. 
					 On display at the venue of the photo exhibition were photos documenting exploits of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un and other photos showing the history of victory and glory covered by the DPRK. 
					
					 Korean films "Songdowon International Children's Camp" and "Masikryong Ski Resort" were shown at the film shows. 
					
					 The director general of the Kim Il Sung Institute of Agricultural Science in Guinea said the DPRK is the country of the people as the name of the country denotes.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 The Korean people do not know what "tax" is like.
					
					 All the policies of the DPRK are intended for the improvement of the people's living standard. 
					
					 The government and army go by the word "the people" in the DPRK. 
					
					 Those who performed distinguished merits for the country and people receive the titles including People's Scientist, People's Sportsperson and People's Artiste.
					
					 The best structures go by the name of people.
					
					 The chairman of the Nigerian Group for the Study of the Songun Politics in his lecture said the President explored the road of building the people's government from an independent stand, not wedded to an established theory and experience of other countries with a great ambition to build the people's country when he was young. 
					
					 After founding the DPRK, the people's country, the President repulsed the U.S. aggression, protecting the sovereignty and dignity of the country, and victoriously led the postwar rehabilitation and construction from debris and socialist construction of several stages.

articles.title: DPRK's Birthday to Be Observed by Foreign Media
articles.content:
DPRK's Birthday to Be Observed by Foreign Media
						
 Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- Russian and Cambodian media carried special write-ups and aired special program between August 20 and 28 on the occasion of the 67th founding anniversary of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (DPRK).
					 The Russian paper Komsomolskaya Pravda devoted one whole page to an article titled "Invincible socialist power" with portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and photos dealing with the might of the heroic Korean People's Army and showing a panoramic view of Pyongyang City.
					
					 The paper said that the President, founder of the DPRK, turned the motherland into a prosperous socialist country. It went on:
					
					 The DPRK has not only defended the banner of socialism but ushered in a new era of building a thriving nation despite the worst difficulties and adversity at the end of the last century under the leadership of H.E. Kim Jong Il who carried forward the cause of the President.
					
					 The might of the DPRK is being more powerfully demonstrated under the leadership of H.E. Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 The DPRK will always shine as an invincible socialist power.
					
					 The Cambodian FM 90.5 Radio said that the wild ambition of the U.S. to stifle the DPRK proved to be a daydream.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The first reason is that socialist Korea holds the great leaders in high esteem.
					
					 The second reason is that it has a great guiding idea.
					
					 The third reason is that the Korean people regard socialism as their life and soul.
					
					 The Apsara TV and Radio Broadcasting Service of Cambodia aired the similar program.

articles.title: Russian Paper Introduces Songdowon International Children's Camp
articles.content:
Russian Paper Introduces Songdowon International Children's Camp
						
 Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- The 33rd issue of Pravda Primoriya, the organ of the Maritime Territorial Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation, carried an article introducing students of the maritime territorial region enjoying camping at the Songdowon International Children's Camp illustrated with their photos.
					 The paper said that Russian students of the maritime territory came back after spending pleasant days under the program of the 30th international children's camping in Songdowon of the DPRK.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 At the camp they had brisk interchange with students of various countries under diverse programs.
					
					 There were an aquarium, gymnasium and others at the camp.
					
					 In the camping period colorful cultural activities including art performance and sports games took place.
					
					 The Russian students started their performance with "Song of General Kim Jong Il".
					
					 Each number of the performance given by students of the Pyongyang Schoolchildren's Palace was acclaimed by the audience.
					
					 The campers spent pleasant days while having diverse programs including visit, dance, exercises, learning to sing songs.
					
					 They experienced in the camping period that the lines and policies of the DPRK's party and government providing everything excellent to the younger generation are being put into practice.

articles.title: Improvement of Inter-Korean Relations Is Requirement of Times: Nigerian Body
articles.content:
Improvement of Inter-Korean Relations Is Requirement of Times: Nigerian Body
						
 Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism posted on its website an article titled "Improvement of relations between north and south of Korea is requirement of times" on August 27.
					 Noting the homogeneous Korean nation with a history spanning 5 000 years is still suffering the tragedy resulting from its split.
					
					 Due to the U.S. which occupied south Korea by force of arms under the mask of "liberator" 70 years ago, Korea was divided into the north and the south. Since then, the Korean nation has suffered untold misfortune and pain.
					
					 It is the Korean nation which has undergone big pain due to distrust and confrontation between the north and the south.
					
					 Putting an end to the history of north-south confrontation is urgently required for defusing the danger of war and ensuring durable peace on the Korean Peninsula, a hot spot in the world.
					
					 It is a fact recognized by the world that the Korean nation is a resourceful and creative nation.
					
					 The improvement of the north-south relations would pave a broad avenue to ensuring peace on the peninsula and achieving uniform development and co-prosperity of the nation.
					
					 It was clearly evidenced by the fact that the north-south relations characterized by distrust and confrontation turned into the ones of reconciliation and cooperation in the wake of the adoption of the historic June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					
					 The north and the south can surely settle any issue if they have a firm will to defuse old distrust and put an end to the history of confrontation from the stand of By Our Nation Itself. 
					
					 What matters is how the south Korean regime responds to the practical proposals made by the DPRK to develop the north-south relations as required by the times and as desired by all Koreans.
					
					 The world hopes to see the north-south relations improve as early as possible.

articles.title: DPRK's Birthday Marked in Cambodia, Bangladesh
articles.content:
DPRK's Birthday Marked in Cambodia, Bangladesh 
						
 Pyongyang, September 4 (KCNA) -- A seminar and photo exhibition took place in Cambodia and a seminar, photo and book exhibition and film show in Bangladesh on August 27 and 29 with the approach of the 67th founding anniversary of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea. 
					 On display at the venues of the events were photos documenting exploits of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un and other photos and books introducing invincibility and solidity of the DPRK. 
					
					 The participants in the film show watched the Korean film "Pyongyang Today."
					
					 The deputy prime minister for Royal Palace of the Kingdom of Cambodia said that Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il were the great men who performed great exploits for the country and its people and made great contributions to the development of the friendly relations between Cambodia and the DPRK. 
					
					 Under their outstanding and tested leadership the DPRK is demonstrating its dignity as an invincible power, he added. 
					
					 The president of the Bangladesh People's League who doubles as chairman of the Bangladesh Self-Reliance Research Centre and other speakers expressed belief that the DPRK, which has won one victory after another in the struggle to defend Korean-style socialism, will surely build a socialist economic power and a highly civilized nation by foiling the persistent moves of the imperialist allied forces to stifle the DPRK as it is led by HE Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un visita Fabrica de Instrumentos de Medicion de Sinuiju
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un visita Fabrica de Instrumentos de Medicion de Sinuiju
						
Pyongyang, 4 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un dirigio en el terreno la Fabrica de Instrumentos de Medicion de Sinuiju.
					En el terreno el Mariscal dijo que recibio con alegria el reporte de que esta vez la fabrica ha desarrollado los instrumentos de medicion de nivel mundial y vino para encontrarse con sus inventores. Y aprecio reiteradamente los meritos de ellos.
					
					Ante todo, el Mariscal recorrio la lapida a la actividad historico-revolucionaria y la sala de educacion en la historia revolucionaria.
					
					Dijo con satisfaccion que la fabrica, a que el Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il prestaban siempre profunda atencion y que el mismo aprecia tanto, materializo otro legado de los grandes lideres dado a la fabrica al desarrollar nuevos y modernos instrumentos de medicion que se utilizaran en varios sectores de la economia nacional y la industria de defensa nacional.
					
					Tras recorrer los talleres de elaboracion y montaje y la sala de divulgacion de ciencias y tecnicas, el Mariscal averiguo detalladamente las propiedades tecnicas y la funcion de nuevos aparatos.
					
					Senalo que el desarrollo de los instrumentos de  medicion sofisticados por las fuerzas y tecnicas nacionales es un exito notable y sirve de fundamento para desarrollar vertiginosamente la rama y acelerar la construccion de la patria prospera. 
					
					Acotando que es muy importante el deber de la fabrica, presento las tareas que se presentan ante ella.
					
					Fijo la meta de produccion de la fabrica insistiendo en empenarse por producir mucho mas instrumentos de medicion que aseguren el alto nivel autoctono, moderno y domestico. 
					
					Para aumentar notablemente la produccion de los ultramodernos instrumentos de medicion al estilo coreano y asegurar su calidad, hay que modernizar la fabrica segun la demanda de la epoca de economia intelectual, asevero. Instruyo transformarla en la fabrica de ahorro de mano de obra y en la ejemplar de la rama al lograr la automatizacion y la aplicacion de la tecnologia CNC en todos los procesos productivos.
					
					Pasando revista al comedor y otras instalaciones de intendencia de la fabrica, recalco que es posible lograr  grandes exitos en la produccion cuando se conceda buenas condiciones de vida a los trabajadores, y enseno los remedios para mejorar la intendencia.
					
					Los obreros de la fabrica son fuertes en el espiritu revolucionario y no hay nada imposible junto con ellos, dijo y prosiguio que el mismo sera el gerente honorario de la fabrica. 
					
					No habra las metas inconquistables cuando nuestra clase obrera viva y luche como los trabajadores de Kunjari de la decada de 1950, apunto y agrego que seria bueno que la fabrica desarrolle junto con el movimiento por la obtencion de la bandera roja de las tres revoluciones el movimiento masivo de otra forma mas alta para asimilar el espiritu y modo de lucha de la clase obrera de Kunjari.
					
					Manifesto la conviccion y esperanza de que los funcionarios y obreros de la fabrica hagan aporte activo a la construccion de la patria prospera al producir muchos instrumentos de medicion a ser enviados a varios sectores de la economia nacional y al ejercito popular con el espiritu revolucionario de materializacion a ultranza, en acato a la linea de la construccion de la potencia prospera y el proposito estrategico del partido. 
					
					Y tomo la foto de recuerdo junto con ellos.
					
					Le acompanaron en esta ocasion Kim Chun Sop, Jo Chun Ryong, Jo Yong Won, Hong Yong Chil y Yun Tong Hyon.

articles.title: Conversaciones entre Yang Hyong Sop y Miguel Mario Diaz Canel Bermudez
articles.content:
Conversaciones entre Yang Hyong Sop y Miguel Mario Diaz Canel Bermudez 
						
Pyongyang, 4 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar este viernes en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae las conversaciones entre Yang Hyong Sop, miembro del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, y Miguel Mario Diaz Canel Bermudez, miembro del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de Cuba y primer vicepresidente de los Consejos de Estado y de Ministros de la Republica de Cuba. 
					Estuvieron presentes, por la parte coreana, el presidente del Comite de Educacion y del Comite Coreano de Solidaridad con Cuba, Kim Sung Du, el subjefe de departamento del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Pak Kun Gwang, el viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores, Sin Hong Chol, el viceministro de Relaciones Economicas con el Extranjero, Ri Kwang Gun, y el vicepresidente del Comite de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero, So Ho Won, y por la cubana,  los miembros de la delegacion. 
					
					En la ocasion ambas partes intercambiaron las opiniones sobre el desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad entre ambos paises y los asuntos de interes mutuo. 
					
					Antes del inicio de las conversaciones, tuvo lugar una ceremonia para recibir a la delegacion estatal de Cuba.

articles.title: Canciller coreano envia mensaje de felicitacion a su homologo cubano
articles.content:
Canciller coreano envia mensaje de felicitacion a su homologo cubano
						
Pyongyang, 4 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El canciller de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Ri Su Yong envio el dia 22 de agosto un mensaje de felicitacion a su homologo de la Republica de Cuba, con motivo del 55o aniversario del establecimiento de relaciones diplomaticas entre la RPDC y Cuba.
					La misiva senala que las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises se fortalecen y se desarrollan cada dia mas en medio de la lucha comun por el socialismo antiimperialista y expresa el irrestricto apoyo y firme solidaridad con la lucha del gobierno y el pueblo del pais caribeno por construir con exito el socialismo.

articles.title: Presidium de APS ofrece banquete en honor de delegacion estatal de Cuba
articles.content:
Presidium de APS ofrece banquete en honor de delegacion estatal de Cuba
						
Pyongyang, 4 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea ofrecio este viernes en el capitalino Palacio de los Congresos Mansudae un banquete en honor de la delegacion estatal de la Republica de Cuba, de visita en Corea. 
					Fueron invitados alli los miembros de la delegacion cubana encabezada por Miguel Mario Diaz Canel Bermudez, miembro del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido Comunista de Cuba y primer vicepresidente de los Consejos de Estado y de Ministros de la Republica de Cuba, y los miembros de la sede diplomatica cubana en la RPDC. 
					
					Estuvieron presentes Yang Hyong Sop, miembro del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y vicepresidente del Presidium de la APS de la RPDC, Kim Sung Du, presidente del Comite de Educacion y del Comite Coreano de Solidaridad con Cuba, y otros funcionarios coreanos. 
					
					Al hacer uso de la palabra, Yang Hyong Sop dijo que la visita a la RPDC de la delegacion estatal cubana marcara un hito importante para desarrollar mas las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises y manifestar plenamente el poderio combativo de los pueblos de ambos paises que marchan hombro a hombro por el camino de la independencia antiimperialista y el socialismo. 
					
					Aprecio mucho que el gobierno y pueblo cubanos expresan el irrestricto apoyo y solidaridad con la justa causa del pueblo coreano observando los principios revolucionarios y la camaraderia y expuso la firme posicion del gobierno de la RPDC de fortalecer generacion tras generacion las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion con el hermano pueblo cubano. 
					
					A su vez, Miguel Mario Diaz Canel Bermudez dijo que se consolidan y se desarrollan bajo la especial atencion del estimado camarada Kim Jong Un las invencibles relaciones de amistad entre Cuba y la RPDC preparadas por el Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il junto con los companeros Fidel Castro Ruz y Raul Castro Ruz.
					
					Agradecio el calido sentimiento y la amigabilidad que los companeros coreanos dispensaron para la delegacion y subrayo que seran eternas las relaciones de amistad entre ambos paises y el pueblo cubano siempre estara con el pueblo coreano.
